intro: Critoniopsis leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its flowers are typically pale green to white, with five petals and stamens. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
